channel.title: Comments on: AngularJS vs Knockout – Templating (5 of 8)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: Thanks Yngve, I was too focused on making it work with custom directives and completely overlook ngInclude. I've added an update above with a link to another example.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Yngve, I was too focused on making it work with custom directives and completely overlook ngInclude. I’ve added an update above with a link to another example.

item.title: By: Yngve Bakken Nilsen
item.dc:creator: Yngve Bakken Nilsen
item.description: For the dynamic templating in AngularJS, you could use the ng-include directive, which takes either a html-file/inline template or the value of a scope-property. Works just like you did for Knockout :)
item.content:encoded: For the dynamic templating in AngularJS, you could use the ng-include directive, which takes either a html-file/inline template or the value of a scope-property. Works just like you did for Knockout ðŸ™‚
